title: Scuba Diving
short_description: Discover vibrant coral reefs and marine life in India's clearest waters.
long_description:
Scuba diving opens up the remaining 70% of the planet—the underwater world. In India, the Andaman & Nicobar Islands and Lakshadweep offer world-class diving comparable to the Maldives or Thailand. Crystal clear blue waters, vibrant coral gardens, and teeming marine life including turtles, manta rays, and reef sharks await.

For beginners, the 'Discover Scuba Dive' (DSD) is the most popular option. It requires no swimming skills; a dedicated instructor holds you and manages your equipment while you breathe underwater and marvel at the sights. For those looking to get certified, PADI/SSI Open Water courses are widely available.

Mainland India also has diving spots—Goa (Grand Island) and Netrani Island (Karnataka) are popular, though visibility is generally lower than the islands. Pondicherry has created unique artificial reefs, making it a great spot for training.

locations.summary: India's premier dive destination with sites like 'The Wall' and 'Dixon's Pinnacle'.
Pristine, untouched coral atolls with incredible visibility.
Heart-shaped island known as the 'Heart of India's Diving', famous for fish life.
Home to 'Temple Reef', an artificial reef teeming with life.
Accessible diving trips for tourists in Goa, includes boat ride and lunch.

opening_hours.time_notes: Boats usually leave early morning (7:30 AM) to catch calm seas.

operating_season.off_season: Monsoon (June–Sept) - visibility helps & seas are rough.
operating_season.season_notes: Pondicherry offers some diving in monsoon depending on weather.

pricing_metadata.disclaimer: Andaman/Lakshadweep prices are higher due to location logistics.

safety_guidelines: Do not fly for 18-24 hours after your last dive (very important).
Fill out medical questionnaire honestly (asthma/heart issues usually disqualify).
Listen to equalizing instructions to prevent ear pain.
Touch nothing—corals are fragile living animals.
equipment_checklist: Seasickness pills (if prone to boat sickness)
major_experiences: Breathing underwater for the first time
Swimming alongside turtles and schools of fish
Boat ride to the dive site

sample_itinerary.one_day: 7:30 AM: Reporting at Dive Shop. 8:00 AM: Boat departure. 8:30 AM: Briefing & shallow water training. 9:30 AM: 25-40 min dive. 11:00 AM: Snack break. 12:30 PM: Return to shore.

booking_methods: Online at PADI certified dive center websites
booking_details.suggested_stay: Barefoot at Havelock, Seashell at Neil Island.
booking_details.how_to_reach: Fly to Port Blair, then ferry to islands. Fly to Goa/Mangalore for mainland diving.

seo.seo_description: Explore the underwater world of India. Best scuba diving in Havelock, Netrani, and Goa. PADI courses and intro dives from ₹3,000.

highlights: Andaman offers the best visibility (20m+) and coral life in India.
No swimming skills required for 'Discover Scuba' introductory dives.
Opportunity to see turtles, octopuses, rays, and sharks.
Underwater photography usually included or available as add-on.
Life-changing experience of entering an alien world.
